type.markdownDescription:
### How to Index Numeric Values
The `number` type can be used to index fields with numeric values of `int32`, `int64`, `dateTime`, and `double` data types. You can use the [equals](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/equals/#std-label-equals-ref), [range](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/range/#std-label-range-ref), and [near](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/near/#std-label-near-ref) operators to query indexed fields of type `number`.

> #### NOTE
> To query numeric values in arrays, you can use only the [range](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/range/#std-label-range-ref) operator.
type.description: Specify this field type for indexing fields of type int32, int64, dateTime or double.

representation.markdownDescription:
### Data type of the field to index. 
Values are:
- `int64` - for indexing large integers without loss of precision and for rounding double values to integers. You can't use this type to index large double values.
- `double` - for indexing large double values without rounding.

To learn more, see [example](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/field-types/number-type/#std-label-number-egs).
representation.description: Specify the type to represent the field being indexes. Choose between int64 or double.

indexIntegers.markdownDescription:
### Specify whether to index or omit indexing `int32` and `int64` type fields. 
Value can be:
- `true` 
- `false`

To learn more, see [example](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/field-types/number-type/#std-label-number-egs).
indexIntegers.description: Specify whether to index or omit indexing int32 and int64 type fields.

indexDoubles.markdownDescription:
### Specify whether to index or omit indexing `double` type values. 
Value can be:
- `true` 
- `false`

To learn more, see [example](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/field-types/number-type/#std-label-number-egs).
indexDoubles.description: Specify whether to index or omit indexing double type fields.
